data.title: Foreign Language Requirement
data.text:
Foreign language courses improve creativity, problem-solving, listening, and memory skills. Knowledge of a second language can increase one’s ability to deal with abstract concepts, expand one’s view of and increase participation in a multicultural world, and enhance job competitiveness.

The courses shown may be used to fulfill undergraduate foreign language requirements in the College of Letters and Science, and schools of Arts and Architecture; Education and Information Studies; Music; Public Affairs; and Theater, Film, and Television.

Updated November 2021
